Key Match Events: Sanju Samson (29), Suryakumar Yadav (29), Abhishek Sharma (16), Nitish Kumar Reddy* (16) and Hardik Pandya* (39) made some important contributions
Arshdeep Singh was awarded as the 'Player of the Match' for picking up 3 wickets at an economy of 3.65 and giving away just 14 runs
Mayank Yadav delivered a maiden over while bowling the sixth over during his T20I debut for India
Mayank Yadav's fastest delivery was 149.9 kmph
Mayank Yadav became the third Indian bowler to bowl a maiden over in a Twenty20 International
Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav-led Indian Cricket team on 6 October defeated Nazmul Hossain Shanto-led Bangladesh cricket team by 7 wickets at New Madhavrao Scindia Cricket Stadium in Gwalior in the first T20I match of the three-match series
India won the toss and decided to field
Chasing 128 runs, India have dominated with its batting attack and won the match in just 11.5 overs as they scored 132/3 runs
India's Hardik Pandya and Nitish Reddy are on the crease
Mustafizur Rahman and Mehidy Hasan Miraz took one wicket each for Bangladesh
Mayank Yadav delivered a maiden over in his T20I debut for India
Mayank Yadav's fastest delivery was 149.9 kmph
Varun Chakravarthy made a comeback to the national squad after a gap of three years
The second T20I match between India and Bangladesh will be played at Arun Jaitley International Stadium in Delhi on 9 October from 7 PM onwards
India's Sanju Samson and Suryakumar Yadav are on the crease
Samson ends the over with a boundary
Suryakumar Yadav hits a SIX on the first delivery, followed by a boundary by Samson
Sanju Samson smashed two boundaries in first over
Taskin Ahmed opens his bowling attack for Bangladesh
Abhishek Sharma welcomes Taskin with a SIX and two boundaries
Taskin Ahmed and Mehidy Hasan Miraz took one wicket each
Bangladesh lost their 8th wicket after a mix-up between Taskin Ahmed and Mehidy Hasan Miraz
Taskin finally has to depart on a score of 12

Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav said, 'We just tried to back our skills and what we decided in the team meeting, it worked out. The way the guys showed character playing on a new ground and the way we batted, it was great'

Suryakumar Yadav added, 'It's a good headache to have when you are on the field on whom to bowl. Every time you have an extra option, it's a good thing. You learn something new every new game. There are always a few areas to improve on, we will sit down and talk about it in the next game'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won the toss and decided to field first
The weather in Gwalior on 6 October is sunny and dry
The maximum temperature is expected to be 36 degrees Celsius, while the lowest will be around 25 degrees Celsius
The new pitch at Gwalior favours the batting side, so it is expected to be a run fest
With dew conditions making things a little concerning, the team that wins the toss might opt to bowl first
